subject: Re: JUnit 4.9 released!
msgSnippet: Interesting. My experience is that it depends on the project; when I run `mvn versions:display-dependency-updates` I frequently see alpha and beta versions.
messageBody:
Interesting. My experience is that it depends on the project; when I run `mvn versions:display-dependency-updates` I frequently see alpha and beta versions. This is especially so for Jersey, but I also recall seeing it for Antlr. See e.g. these versions:

http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/com/sun/jersey/jersey-client/
http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/antlr/antlr/

Regards,
Stephan

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, CÃ©dric Beust â" <cedric@...> wrote:
>
> On Thu, Aug 25, 2011 at 7:45 AM, sschroev <stephan202@...> wrote:
>
> > W.r.t. your last question: as far as I could tell the beta versions were
> > indeed not available in Maven central;
>
>
> As far as I know, beta versions are never allowed in Maven Central, you need
> to use the beta repository (and tell your pom to point there).
>
> --
> Cédric
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
